Description: Hello and thank you for looking at this auction. My auctions will include fairly priced nice vintage, rare, cool and collectable guitars, amps and basses that I love playing myself. They are setup ready to rock right out of the box. All items are packed and shipped with care and full insurance. Consider adding me to your favorite sellers or checking out my other auctions if you are interested in such things! --NO RESERVE AUCTION ENDS THIS SUNDAY 2:00 PM PST, 5:00 PM EST-- Real Vintage 1966 Gibson SG Special Electric Guitar with Hardcase Excellent sounding and playing real vintage Gibson SG Special. This one has a really nice chunky neck...fills your hand perfectly. I have owned and enjoyed the guitar roughly the past 10 years and it rocks. Action is even and low all the way up the neck. It is a pro Polaris White refin. You can see where the former vibrato mounting holes were doweled (I point out behind the bridge in the photos). Pickups are Duncan Antiquities, otherwise original parts to my best knowledge. Please refer to all the photos for condition and specs and watch video demo below. Pots read: "1376607" (dating to early 1966)Serial number: "2744XX"Tuners: Double line KlusonNut: 1 11/16"Neck depth: roughly .875-.950 (1st fret-12th fret)Finish: Polaris White with age appropriate finish checking and "creaming" of the white finishHardware: In good condition with age appropriate patinaWeight: 6.05 lbs Video Demo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4ezXRjsIPmA Thank you for looking and best of luck bidding! Additional questions can be answered at call/text: 760-three 34-three 887 Please contact for international bidding eligibility and a shipping quote. All import duties will be the responsibility of the buyer. Guitar must be able to be fully insured.
Title: Real Vintage 1966 Gibson SG Special Polaris White USA Made Electric Guitar/Case
Subtitle: VIDEO DEMO INSIDE, Featherweight 6.05 lbs!
ConditionDescription: Guitar has original hardcase, good condition outside and inside, all latches function well.  The hinges are not the best so the case needs to be aligned properly when putting the top down.  I would say the case is appropriate for storage and would probably use another one if you are traveling or carrying the guitar regularly.  Guitar to the best of my knowledge has original tuners, knobs, wiring harness, Duncan Antiquity pickups, pro Polaris White refin and relicing which looks age appropriate.  There is a lot of age appropriate finish checking and the hardware has age appropriate patina.  Frets in great shape, nice neck and smooth dark fingerboard.
